meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the immunological response of the body to the flu virus.
meanings.sent2: Researchers conducted an immunological study to understand how vaccines work.
meanings.sent3: The immunological dance between viruses and the immune system is like a strategic game.
meanings.sent4: Her immunological shield protected her from getting sick during flu season.
meanings.sent5: The immunological memory of the body can recognize past invaders and fight them off.

meanings.definition: involving the study of the immune system
meanings.sent1: The immunological research team discovered a new way to boost immunity.
meanings.sent2: Students in the immunological class learned about white blood cells and antibodies.
meanings.sent3: The immunological investigation into allergies revealed surprising connections.
meanings.sent4: His mind was an immunological fortress, absorbing every detail of immune responses.
meanings.sent5: The immunological exploration opened doors to understanding complex defense mechanisms.

meanings.definition: pertaining to immunity or the body's defense against disease
meanings.sent1: The immunological response helped the body fight off the infection.
meanings.sent2: Doctors recommended an immunological boost to strengthen the patient's defenses.
meanings.sent3: The immunological superhero costume was a hit at the hospital party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an immunological shield against negativity and illness.
meanings.sent5: The immunological fortress of the body stood strong against various threats.
